sen.j: 中宮寺（ちゅうぐうじ）は、奈良県生駒郡斑鳩町の法隆寺に隣接する、聖徳太子ゆかりの寺院である。
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple, next to Horyu-ji Temple in Ikaruga-cho Town, Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture, is noted in connection with Prince Shotoku.
Chugu-ji Temple, next to Horyu-ji Temple in Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture, is noted in connection with Prince Shotoku.
sen.cmt: Ikarugaの前の余分なスペースを削除しました。また、指示書の例に従い、choの後のTownを削除しました。
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple, next to Horyu-ji Temple in Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture, is noted in connection with Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: 宗派は聖徳宗に属す。
sen.e: It belongs to the Shotoku sect.
It belongs to the Shotoku sect.
It belongs to the Shotoku sect.

sen.j: 山号を法興山と称し、本尊は如意輪観音である。
sen.e: Its sango, Temple's title, is Hokozan and its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its sango (temple's title) is Hokozan and its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion).
sen.cmt: Temple's titleの前後のコンマをとり、括弧をつけました。また、Compassionのあとに）を加えました。
sen.e: Its sango (temple's title) is Hokozan and its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion).

sen.j: 開基（創立者）は聖徳太子とされている。
sen.e: Its Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) is said to be Prince Shotoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) is said to be Prince Shotoku.
Its Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) is said to be Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: 推古天皇29年（621年）、聖徳太子が母・穴穂部間人皇女（あなほべのはしひとこうごう）の御所を寺としたと伝える。
sen.e: In 621 Prince Shotoku. is reported to have made the gosho (Imperial Palace) of his mother, Anahobe no hashihitohime a temple.
It is said that Prince Shotoku have remade the gosho (Imperial Palace) of his mother, Anahobe no hashihitohime, into a temple in 621.
sen.cmt: reportはこの場合は適切でないと思いますので左記のように変更しました。621のあとにコンマを入れました。Shotokuのあとのピリオドを削除しました。Hashihitohimeのあとにコンマを入れました。
sen.e: It is said that Prince Shotoku have remade the gosho (Imperial Palace) of his mother, Anahobe no hashihitohime, into a temple in 621.

sen.j: 中宮寺は、現在は法隆寺東院に隣接しているが、創建当初は500メートルほど東にあった。
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple is now next to (East Precinct) of Horyu-ji Temple, but it was 500meter east when it was first set up.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple is now next to Toin (East Precinct) of Horyu-ji Temple, but it was located 500 meter east when it was originally set up.
sen.cmt: East Precinctの前に、Toinを追加しました。firstをoriginallyに変更しました。500の前にlocatedを、Meterの前にスペースを入れました。
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple is now next to Toin (East Precinct) of Horyu-ji Temple, but it was located 500 meter east when it was originally set up.

sen.j: 現在地に移転したのは16世紀末頃と推定される。
sen.e: It is assumed to have been relocated to the current place around the end of the 16th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is assumed that the temple was relocated to the current place around the end of the 16th century.
sen.cmt: relocatedの主語を挿入しました。Have beenをwasに変更しました。
sen.e: It is assumed that the temple was relocated to the current place around the end of the 16th century.

sen.j: 創建当時の中宮寺跡は1963年（昭和38年）に発掘調査が行われた。
sen.e: In 1963 the site of Chugu-ji Temple was dug up for research of how it was when founded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1963, an excavational investigation was conducted in the original site of Chugu-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 1963の後に、コンマを入れました。また、創建当時の様子の調査と訳されていますが、創建当時の場所で調査を行ったの意味だと思うのでその様に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1963, an excavational investigation was conducted in the original site of Chugu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 大阪の四天王寺と同様に、金堂と塔を前後（南北方向）に並べる四天王寺式伽藍に似た配置であったことがわかっている。
sen.e: What has been found out is that the temple, like Shitenno-ji Temple in Osaka, was built with the Shitenno-ji-style temple layout, in which the Kon-do Hall (main hall of a Buddhist temple) and a pagoda are arranged ahead and behind (north and south).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: What has been found out is that the temple, like Shitenno-ji Temple in Osaka, was built with the Shitenno-ji-style temple layout, in which the Kon-do Hall (main hall of a Buddhist temple) and the pagoda are arranged ahead and behind (north and south).
sen.cmt: pagodaのまえのaをtheに変更しました。
sen.e: What has been found out is that the temple, like Shitenno-ji Temple in Osaka, was built with the Shitenno-ji-style temple layout, in which the Kon-do Hall (main hall of a Buddhist temple) and the pagoda are arranged ahead and behind (north and south).

sen.j: （講堂、回廊等未確認。）
sen.e: (Kodo Hall, cloister, and so forth have not been researched yet.)
(the Kodo (hall), cloister, and so forth have not been researched yet.)
sen.cmt: Hallの前後に括弧を加えました。
sen.e: (the Kodo (hall), cloister, and so forth have not been researched yet.)

sen.j: 中宮寺は平安時代以降衰微したが、江戸時代初期の慶長7年（1602年）、慈覚院宮を初代門跡に迎え、以後門跡尼寺として今日に至っている。
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple had fallen into a decline since the Heian Period but it has remained up to today as a convent whose chief nun is an Imperial Princess since Jikakuin no miya assumed the first monzeki (a member of nobility or imperial family who resided in temples formerly led by founder of sect, temple).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple fell into a decline after the Heian Period but it has remained as a monzeki temple up to today since Jikakuin no miya assumed the first monzeki (chief nun) in the early Edo period (1602).
sen.cmt: 江戸時代初期の1602が訳漏れ。より自然な表現になるように左記のように変更しました。Coventはキリスト教の修道院を指すようなので、単にtempleに変更しました。
sen.e: Chugu-ji Temple fell into a decline after the Heian Period but it has remained as a monzeki temple up to today since Jikakuin no miya assumed the first monzeki (chief nun) in the early Edo period (1602).

sen.j: （門跡寺院とは、代々皇族、貴族などが住持する格式の高い寺のこと。）
sen.e: (The monzeki temple refers to a temple of high rank where members of imperial family and nobility enter the priesthood. for generations)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (A monzeki temple is a prestigious temple where members of imperial family and nobility resided for the priesthood for generations.)
sen.cmt: より自然な表現になるように左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: (A monzeki temple is a prestigious temple where members of imperial family and nobility resided for the priesthood for generations.)

sen.j: 境内は夢殿のある法隆寺東院のすぐ東に接する子院地を拝借している。
sen.e: Its precinct is a borrowed land from a branch temple bordering right east of Toin of Horyu-ji Temple where Yumedono stood.
Its precinct is a borrowed land from a branch temple bordering right east of Toin of Horyu-ji Temple where Yumedono (Hall of Dreams) stood.
sen.cmt: Yumedonoの後に(Hall of Dreams) を入れました。
sen.e: Its precinct is a borrowed land from a branch temple bordering right east of Toin of Horyu-ji Temple where Yumedono (Hall of Dreams) stood.

sen.j: 本堂は宣仁親王妃喜久子の発願で1968年（昭和43年）に建立した和風の現代建築である。
sen.e: Hondo is a wooden modern Japanese style architecture built in 1968 on the request of Princess Kikuko, the wife of Imperial Prince Nobuhito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hondo (main hall) is a modern Japanese style architecture built in 1968 on the request of Princess Kikuko, the wife of Imperial Prince Nobuhito.
sen.cmt: Hondoの後に、（main hall)を入れました。また、Woodenを削除しました。
sen.e: Hondo (main hall) is a modern Japanese style architecture built in 1968 on the request of Princess Kikuko, the wife of Imperial Prince Nobuhito.

sen.j: 設計は吉田五十八（いそや）である。
sen.e: Isoya YOSHIDA designed it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Isoya YOSHIDA designed it.
Isoya YOSHIDA designed it.

sen.j: 旧伽藍は、現伽藍から東へ550ｍほどの所にあり、史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The former Garan. 550 meter east from the current Garan, is designated as a historic site.
The former Garan, located 550 meter east from the current Garan, is designated as a historic site.
sen.cmt: 550のまえのピリオドをコンマに変え、その後にlocatedを入れました。
sen.e: The former Garan, located 550 meter east from the current Garan, is designated as a historic site.

sen.j: 住所は、奈良県生駒郡斑鳩町法隆寺東2。
sen.e: Its address is Horyuji Higashi 2, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Its address is Horyuji Higashi 2, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Its address is Horyuji Higashi 2, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 木造菩薩半跏像 - 本尊。
sen.e: Mokuzo Bosatsu Hanka Zo (the wooden statue of Bosatsu who made the legs cross)--honzon (principal image of Buddha
Mokuzo Bosatsu Hanka Zo (the wooden statue of Bosatsu) -- Honzon (principal image of Buddha)
sen.cmt: honzonのｈを大文字にしました。Buddhaの後に）を入れました。Made the legs crossとありますが、半跏はあぐらとは違い足を組んだ状態ではないようです。この像の写真をみても、足を組んでいないようだったのでこの部分を削除しました。
sen.e: Mokuzo Bosatsu Hanka Zo (the wooden statue of Bosatsu) -- Honzon (principal image of Buddha)

sen.j: 飛鳥時代の作。
sen.e: It is a work of the Asuka period.
It is a work of the Asuka Period.
sen.cmt: 他の部分では大文字が多く使われていたので、periodのｐを大文字にしました。
sen.e: It is a work of the Asuka Period.

sen.j: 広隆寺の弥勒菩薩半跏像とよく比較される。
sen.e: It is often compared with Maitreya Bodhisattva in a semi-lotus position of Koryu-ji Temple.
It is often compared with Maitreya Bodhisattva in a semi-lotus position of Koryu-ji Temple.
It is often compared with Maitreya Bodhisattva in a semi-lotus position of Koryu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 寺伝では如意輪観音だが、これは平安時代以降の名称で、当初は弥勒菩薩半跏思惟像として造立されたものと思われる。
sen.e: Its temple legend says it is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion), but it has been named so after the Heian Period and considered to have originally been built as Maitreya Bodhisattva in manas in a semi-lotus position.

Its temple legend says it is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion), but it has been named so after the Heian Period and considered to have originally been built as Maitreya Bodhisattva in manas in a semi-lotus position.

Its temple legend says it is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion), but it has been named so after the Heian Period and considered to have originally been built as Maitreya Bodhisattva in manas in a semi-lotus position.

sen.j: 材質はクスノキ材で、寄木技法による作例としては最古。
sen.e: Made of camphor tree timber, it is the oldest example of the yosegi-zukuri technique.
The statue is made of camphor tree timber and the oldest work using the yosegi-zukuri technique.
sen.cmt: 主語を統一して明確にするために、左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: The statue is made of camphor tree timber and the oldest work using the yosegi-zukuri technique.

sen.j: 国宝指定の際の官報告示は単に「木造菩薩半跏像」である。
sen.e: It is simply announced as "Mokuzo Bosatsu Hanka Zo (The wooden statue of Bosatsu who made the legs cross)" through official gazetts when designated as a natural treasure.
It is simply referred to as 'Mokuzo Bosatsu Hanka Zo (The wooden statue of Bosatsu)' in the official gazette notifying that the statue was designated as a national treasure.
sen.cmt: 上記の理由でMade the legs crossを削除しています。natural をnationalに変更し、“”を‘’に変更しました。
sen.e: It is simply referred to as 'Mokuzo Bosatsu Hanka Zo' (The wooden statue of Bosatsu) in the official gazette notifying that the statue was designated as a national treasure.

sen.j: 天寿国繍帳残闕（てんじゅこくしゅうちょう ざんけつ） - 染織品は、陶磁器、金属製品などに比べて保存がむずかしい。
sen.e: Textiles of Tenjukoku Shucho Zanketsu(Mandara) are more difficult to preserve than earth ware and metal products.
Tenjukoku Shucho Zanketsu(Mandala) -- Dyed fabric is more difficult to preserve than pottery and metal products.
sen.cmt: Mandaraのミススペル。より正確な訳にするため、単語、語順を変更しました。
sen.e: Tenjukoku Shucho Zanketsu(Mandala): Dyed fabric is more difficult to preserve than pottery and metal products.
sen.cmt: ハイフンをコロンに変更

sen.j: 本品は断片とはいえ、飛鳥時代の染織の遺品としてきわめて貴重なもの。
sen.e: These textiles, although in fragments, are quite precious as a relic of the Asuka period.
Although this work is a fragment of a dyed fabric, it is very precious as a relic of dyed fabrics of the Asuka Period.
sen.cmt: より自然な訳にするため、単語、語順を変更しました。
sen.e: Although this work is a fragment of a dyed fabric, it is very precious as a relic of dyed fabrics of the Asuka Period.

sen.j: 現在、奈良国立博物館に寄託。
sen.e: It has been placed in the care of Nara National Museum.
It is currently deposited in the Nara National Museum.
sen.cmt: より自然な訳にするため、寄託をdepositに変更しました。また、Naraの前にTheを入れました。
sen.e: It is currently deposited in the Nara National Museum.

sen.j: 1982年に製作されたレプリカが現在本堂に安置されている。
sen.e: A replica made in 1982 is now enshrined in the main hall.
A replica made in 1982 is now enshrined in Hondo.
sen.cmt: the main hall をHondoに変更しました。
sen.e: A replica made in 1982 is now enshrined in Hondo.

sen.j: 聖徳太子の母、穴穂部間人皇女と聖徳太子の死去を悼んで王妃橘大女郎が多くの采女らとともに造った刺繍、曼荼羅である。
sen.e: It is Mandala (or a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world) embroidered by Anahobe no hashihitohime, Prince Shotoku's mother with many uneme (maids-in-waiting at the court) in mourning for the prince.

It is Mandala (or a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world) embroidered by Anahobe no hashihitohime, Prince Shotoku's mother with many uneme (maids-in-waiting at the court) in mourning for the prince.

It is Mandala (or a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world view) embroidered by Princess Tachibana no Ooiratsume with many uneme (maids-in-waiting at the court) in mourning for the Anahobe no hashihitohime, Prince Shotoku's mother and the prince.

sen.j: もと2帳。
sen.e: It originally consists of two works.
It originally consists of two works.
It originally consists of two works.

sen.j: その銘は『上宮聖徳法王帝説』にある。
sen.e: Its name is found in Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu (Biography of Shotoku Taishi).
Its name is found in "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu (Biography of Shotoku Taishi)".
sen.cmt: Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsuの前後に“”を加えました。
sen.e: Its name is found in "Jogu Shotoku Hooteisetsu" (Biography of Shotoku Taishi).

sen.j: 紙製文殊菩薩立像－鎌倉時代の作。
sen.e: Paper-made Monjubosatsu ritsuzo (Standing Image of Manjusri (bodhisattva)) --a work of the Kamakura Period
Paper-made Monjubosatsu ritsuzo (Standing Image of Manjusri (bodhisattva)) -- A work of the Kamakura Period
sen.cmt: workの前のaを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Paper-made Monjubosatsu ritsuzo (Standing Image of Manjusri (bodhisattva)) -- A work of the Kamakura Period

sen.j: 紙張子で造像した珍しい仏像で、日本の重要文化財指定の彫刻のうち「紙製」はこの像のみである。
sen.e: It is a Buddha statue of papier mache, only one paper-made sculpture of important cultural property of Japan.
It is a papier mache statue of Buddha and the only paper-made sculpture in important cultural properties of Japan.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現になるように左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: It is a papier mache statue of Buddha and the only paper-made sculpture in important cultural properties of Japan.

sen.j: 東京国立博物館に寄託。
sen.e: It has been placed in the care of Nara National Museum.
The work is deposited in the Tokyo National Museum.
sen.cmt: Nara National MuseumをTokyo National Museum.に変更しています。より自然な訳にするため、寄託をdepositに変更しました。
sen.e: The work is deposited in the Tokyo National Museum.

sen.j: 紙本墨書瑜伽師地論 二巻－奈良時代の作。
sen.e: Two volumes of Shihon Bokusho Yugashiji Ro-- a work in the Nara Period
Two volumes of Shihon Bokusho Yugashiji Ro-- a work in the Nara Period
Two volumes of Shihon Bokusho Yugashiji Ron: A work in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: Ro → Ronハイフンをコロンに変更ピリオド追加

sen.j: 刺繍阿弥陀三尊来迎像－鎌倉時代の作。
sen.e: The embroidery which describes that Amitabha and Sanzon come to meet a dying person.--work in the Kamakura Period
The embroidery which describes that Amitabha and Sanzon come to meet a dying person -- A work in the Kamakura Period
sen.cmt: 文章ではないので、personの後ろのピリオドを削除しました。また、workの前にAを入れました。
sen.e: The embroidery which describes that Amitabha and Sanzon come to meet a dying person: A work in the Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: ハイフンをコロンに変更ピリオド追加

sen.j: 木彫雨宝童子立像－鎌倉時代の作。
sen.e: Wooden Uho Doji ritsudo (Standing Image of Uho Doji) -- a work in the Kamakura period
Wooden Uho Doji ritsuzo (Standing Image of Uho Doji) -- A work in the Kamakura Period
sen.cmt: ritsudoをritsuzoに直しました。また、workの前のaとperiodのｐを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Wooden Uho Doji ritsuzo (Standing Image of Uho Doji): A work in the Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: ハイフンをコロンに変更ピリオド追加

sen.j: 〒636-0111 奈良県生駒郡斑鳩町法隆寺北1-1-2
sen.e: 1-1-2, Horyuji kita, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture 636-0111
1-1-2, Horyuji kita, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture 636-0111
1-1-2, Horyuji kita, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture 636-0111

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道法隆寺駅下車。
sen.e: Get off at Horyuji Station, West Japan Railway Company
Get off at Horyuji Station of West Japan Railway Company.
sen.cmt: Westの前にof を加えました。
sen.e: Get off at Horyuji Station of West Japan Railway Company.
